Body: First of all it's not a decentralized exchange. It's a centralized exchange that is created as a telegram bot. The bot takes inputs and shows you the interface, and through the Telegram servers it gets sent to our servers which then process the requests. We don't know your IP address or really any meaningful information, except for what you give us. That is the core feature of our platform, it's an approach that allows us to create a very safe and powerful exchange due to the two layers of security (Telegram servers or other messengers - Our servers that are hidden from the public view). Author: ExeniumExchange
Title: [ANN] Exenium.io - a fully functional chat-bot crypto exchange in Messangers
Body: The tokens do not provide dividends. They are used for payment of our commission fees, listing fees etc. as an alternative to other currencies such as BTC, USD etc. Paying with XNT gives a 10% discount on everything, including listing (where such a discount becomes quite significant). We are also not a decentralized exchange, in the sense that the trades are conducted via blockchain smart contracts. It's all done by our servers. It could be said that we offer a middle-ground solution, where we benefit from the performance of centralized servers, while at the same time hiding them from the public eye (and as such, hackers).  As for participating in the ICO, we do not at this time implement geographic locking. Residents of the US or China can in fact buy our tokens, but they do so at their own risk, and should be aware of the legal and tax implications of this. Our disclaimer applies to residents, so US citizens but not US residents should be ok.  We are planning to partner up with a US firm to be able to fully provide services to US residents, but this will apply to the exchange itself, not the ICO.
